results.title: Footlight parade
results.creator_credit: Lloyd Bacon, Robert Lord and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Set against the backdrop of Hollywood in the 1930’s, James Cagney stars as a Broadway musical comedy producer/director who finds himself without a job due to the arrival of talkies. He devises an inventive way of keeping the loan sharks at bay, by creating prologues that can precede the talkies themselves, riding on the coat tails of the very thing that put him out of business in the first place. The comedy and drama of the film is derived from the activities of the players who are part of Cagney’s troupe producing the prologues. There’s the gold digger (Claire Dodd), the disgruntled ex-wife (Renee Whitney), the secretary with secret artistic abilities (Ruby Keeler), the faithful Girl Friday (Joan Blondell) who stands by the man who doesn’t know that she loves him, the long suffering personal assistant (Hugh Herbert), and the young protegee (Dick Powell). Numbers created and staged by Busby Berkeley and include hits such as “Honeymoon hotel”, “Shanghai Lil” and “By a waterfall”. This was the third of Warner’s backstage musicals released in 1933, the other two being “42nd Street” and “The Gold diggers of 1933”.

results.title: Heartbreak ridge
results.brief_description: Gunnery Sergeant Tom Highway (Clint Eastwood), war veteran and Medal of Honor recipient from details in Korea and Vietnam has one last tour of duty prior to his forced retirement from the U.S Marines - training a bunch of new recruits. The brashness of a youth who have experienced war passively through film and literature is incongruous with Tom’s traditional hard nosed ways, yet Tom has proven himself to be a complex character also, as the film follows his attempt to rekindle a past relationship with lines that he too has learnt from books. Tom’s skills for preparing men for battle are put to the test when the recruits experience war for the first time during an invasion of Granada. Cast also includes Marsha Mason, Everett McGill, Moses Gunn, Mario Van Peebles and Eileen Heckart.

results.title: Surviving Picasso
results.creator_credit: James Ivory, David L. Wolper, Ismail Merchant, Merchant Ivory Productions and Wolper Productions
results.brief_description: One of the 20th century’s most influential painters, Picasso was also notorious for destroying the lives of those who loved him. Of the five major loves in his life, only one was strong enough to withstand his mad brilliance and walk away intact. Francoise Gilot (Natascha McElhone) was 23 years old when Picasso saw her in a bistro and invited her home. They become lovers and have a 10-year affair that produces his children Claude and Paloma. During their relationship Picasso (Anthony Hopkins) proved himself a brilliant artist and an appalling human being. Narcissistic, self-centered, cruel and sadistically manipulative, he treated his paint brushes better than he did his women, most of whom emerged from his grasp broken husks of their former selves. The screen play by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala is adapted from the biography by Ariana Stassinopoulos Huffington. Cast includes Julianne Moore, Joss Ackland, Peter Eyre, Jane Lapotaire, Bob Peck, Diane Venora and Joan Plowright.

results.title: Serenade
results.creator_credit: Anthony Mann, Henry Blanke and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A musical feast for lovers of opera and fans of tenor Mario Lanza. Lanza plays Damon Vincenti, an unknown tenor who is plucked from obscurity when he is discovered by society patroness Kendall Hale (Joan Fontaine). With smooth impresario Charles Winthrop (Vincent Price) and voice teacher Maestro Marcatello (Joseph Calleia) behind him Vincenti is on the road to a great career as a tenor, but he becomes mesmerised by Kendall Hale. Hale has already had a string of heartbroken men who have been her pet projects in the past, and Damon is set to be her next victim. On the night of his debut at the New York Opera she drops him for her next protege. Damon is devastated and flees in the middle of his debut. He escapes to Mexico and is unable to sing. He is ‘rescued’ by Juana Montes (Sara Montiel) a fiery but patient Mexican girl whose father was a bull fighter. Eventually Damon marries Juana and they head back to America to restart his career. A showdown between the two women is set up as they fight over Vincenti. Fans of Lanza’s voice will appreciate the numerous songs he sings in this film, including “Serenade”,”Ave Maria” and “Nessun Dorma”.

results.title: Cole Porter's Les girls [Widescreen]
results.brief_description: Members of the now defunct “Barry Nichols and Les Girls” musical act (Gene Kelly, Kay Kendall, Mitzi Gaynor) are re-united under inauspicious circumstances. It appears that one performer, Lady Wren, has published a no holds barred memoir, highlighting her years, and the romantic escapades within the cabaret group. A libel suit is brought forward by another member of the troupe, suing for defamation of character. This leads to a courtroom setting in which they attempt to reach the truth behind the story. Through flashback inspired by Sybil’s memoirs, stories of suicide, unrequited love, and love spurned are recounted in Rashomon like style to reveal vastly different accounts in this witty, delightful musical. Music and lyrics by Cole Porter. (Awards: Academy award for Best Costume Design, Orry-Kelly).

results.title: Bells are ringing
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Judy Holliday reprises her stage role of switchboard operator Ella Peterson at the Susanswerphone company run by her cousin, Sue (Jean Stapleton). Ella has an uncanny knack of becoming involved with the lives of the Manhattan clients she services. One client in particular, a playboy writer know only as Plaza 0-4433 (Dean Martin), has developed a curious relationship with Ella, confiding in a faceless voice that he imagines belongs to a little old lady, not knowing that the young Ella has fallen in love with the voice at the end of the line. The police are suspicious of the Susanswerphone company and think its the front for a house of ill repute, thus Ella is also shadowed by a dim witted police official determined to get the real story. His pursuit of Ella blinds him to the fact that there is a real criminal on the loose (Eddie Foy Jnr), who poses as a record executive and uses the names of famous composers as a secret code for racetracks around the continent. Being the dedicated switchboard operator that she is, Ella takes it upon herself to protect the privacy of her clients from police scrutiny and delivers the messages in person (incognito of course). Thus she gets to meet Plaza 0-4433, aka Jeffrey Moss, in the flesh, and just in the nick of time too, saving him from wallowing in alcoholism because he can’t come up with an idea for a play. Romance blossoms between Ella and Jeffrey, but can it survive based on lies, and how will Ella reconcile her two personas? This was Holliday’s final film appearance. Adapted from a Broadway musical by Betty Comden, Adolph Green and Jule Styne.

results.title: Andersonville
results.creator_credit: John Frankenheimer, David W. Rintels and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: Andersonville was the notorious Confederate prison where Union soldiers were kept as prisoners of war. It is a place where men who once fought alongside each other now kill for the shirts off their backs. Sergeant McSpadden (Frederic Forrest) and Josiah Day (Jarrod Emick) lead a fearless band of men against the brutality of the most notorious prison of its time and the savagery of its inmates. Hunted like animals and tortured without mercy, they must trust in each other and be willing to sacrifice their own lives for the chance to escape. Frankenheimer creates a powerful portrayal of the struggle for freedom where the only law is the law of survival.

results.title: Kissin' cousins
results.creator_credit: Gene Nelson, Sam Katzman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays a dual role in this film - Airforce Lieutenant Josh Morgan, and a countrified Jody Tatum. Morgan is sent by the Government on the unenviable job of trying to secure hillbilly land for a proposed missile base. Much to Morgan’s surprise he is faced with a blonde, country version of himself which means double the songs and women. Cast also includes Arthur O’Connell, Glenda Farrell, Jack Albertson and Pam Austin. Includes the following songs; “Kissin cousins”, “Barefoot ballad” and “Tender feeling”.

results.title: It happened at the world's fair
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, Ted Richmond, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Turner Entertainment
results.brief_description: Friends and pilots Mike Edwards (Elvis Presley) and Danny Burke (Gary Lockwood) find themselves hitchhiking a ride with a Chinese farmer and his niece who are on their way to the World Fair in Seattle. They leave in their wake creditors, the welfare board, smugglers and a gangster, while still finding time to woo women, gamble and croon along the way. Although this is not one of Elvis’ best features, it still includes a few memorable songs such as “One broken heart for sale”, “How would you like to be” and “Take me to the fair”. Cast also includes Joan O’Brien.

results.title: Black belt Jones
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse, Fred Weintraub, Paul Heller and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Pop Boyd (Scatman Crothers) owns a thriving karate school near downtown Los Angeles. Unfortunately it sits on a piece of land upon which the local mob wants to build its own ‘civic centre’. When the gangsters’ muscling of Pop leads to tragedy, Black Belt Jones (Jim Kelly) steps forward to exact his own brand of lightning-charged revenge. Filmmaker Robert Crouse, who showcased Bruce Lee in ‘Enter the dragon’ and Jackie Chan in ‘The big brawl’, serves up masterful action sequences in which every move is choreographed like a ballet. Cast also includes Gloria Hendry, Eric Laneuville, Alan Weeks, Andre Philippe and Vincent Barbi. See also ‘Game of death’ (1978), ‘Enter the dragon’ (1973), ‘The big brawl’ (1980).

When the gangsters’ muscling of Pop leads to tragedy, Black Belt Jones (Jim Kelly) steps forward to exact his own brand of lightning-charged revenge. Filmmaker Robert Crouse, who showcased Bruce Lee in ‘Enter the dragon’ and Jackie Chan in ‘The big brawl’, serves up masterful action sequences in which every move is choreographed like a ballet. Cast also includes Gloria Hendry, Eric Laneuville, Alan Weeks, Andre Philippe and Vincent Barbi. See also ‘Game of death’ (1978), ‘Enter the dragon’ (1973), ‘The big brawl’ (1980).
